column4: How do I make /var/www/multicraft/protected/runtime writeable by the user 'minecraft'? I have looked through those permissions and just got more confused..
You make sure the "minecraft" user owns it with "chown minecraft: /var/www/multicraft/protected/runtime"
Then make sure "owner" has write permission bits set using chmod
I don't have the user owner though blazemore
So chmod 644 would be owner read/write, world-read
if you don't own it, you can't change permissions on it. Obviously.
I did chown minecraft: /var/www/multicraft/protected/runtime but same error
Otherwise the whole concept of security would be pointless. cuddylier root can do it
Yeah, I made this use seperate users though which seems wrong..
I think the command worked as I'm using the root account currently but still same error :S
When I changed the file permission numbers it worked but I want to do that without changing those permissions
'Application runtime path "/var/www/multicraft/protected/runtime" is not valid. Please make sure it is a directory writable by the Web server process.'
What user is running the "web server process"?
